record.description: Student publications have always been an integral part of campus life at the University of Chicago. On October 1, 1892, the first student paper, the "University of Chicago Weekly" began publication. At the time this photograph was taken Fredrick Day Nichols was managing editor and William Pierce Lovett, assistant editor. Associate editors were: G. W. Axelson, Abraham T. Bowers, Agnes S. Cook, J. S. Brown, H. T. Clarke, H. D. Hubbard, C. S. Pike, W. W. Atwood, J. P. Whyte, J. W. Linn, Elizabeth McWilliams, Martha F. Klock, W. A. Payne, Edith E. Schwarz, H. T. Woodruff, H. L. Ickes, and W. O. Wilson. The board of illustrators were W. D. Richardson, P. B. Eckhart, and H. H. Hewitt. Charles H. Gallion served as business manager and Wilber M. Kelso as assistant business manager.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: PR stamp on duplicate copy, both copies mounted on board.
